snippet: Human rights once united Israel with America. But in today’s discourse, the tone has radically changed.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Avraham Burg, a former speaker of the Knesset, contends that the relationship between America and Israel has fundamentally changed to one of shared threats and fears, as opposed to a mutual commitment to democracy and human rights; urges Israel to strive for a true and robust democracy, with a constitution that creates a government that behaves with fairness and equality for all persons without prejudice based on religion, race or gender.
lead_paragraph: Human rights once united Israel with America. But in today’s discourse, the tone has radically changed.
